intro: Chrysosplenium lanuginosum var. lanuginosum, commonly known as the downy chrysosplenium, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves that are often covered in fine, downy hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, typically in clusters at the ends of stems. It prefers moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in its native habitats.
